translated: ‘A Buddha will appear in the world;
I made an offering at the birth;
There is no offering like this,
like the offering at the birth.
I delighted in my own mind;
Having made an offering at the birth,

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Wherever I was reborn,🔽as a god or human,
this is the fruit of the offering at the birth.
they were not able to anger me;
this is the fruit of the offering at the birth.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the offering at the birth.
The name of the offering is Supāricariyā,
In the third period after this,
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Jātipūjaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā jātipūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Jātipūjakattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā jātipūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  jātipūjaka therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Story of the Elder Jātipūjaka is the tenth.
